text: Loretta King Hadler (August 20, 1917 – September 10, 2007) was an American actress, best known for the brevity of her career and her relationship with director Ed Wood. ==Biography== Born in Phoenix, Arizona, she starred in Wood's 1955 Bride of the Monster and, during the 1970s, she appeared in two movies by director Horace Jackson, Johnny Tough and Joey, under the name Loretta Hadler. In 2007, she died of natural causes in Century City, California, and was survived by her husband, Herman Hadler. ==Legacy== King was portrayed by Juliet Landau in the 1994 Tim Burton bio-pic Ed Wood. ==External links== * ==References== Category:1917 births Category:2007 deaths Category:American film actresses Category:Actresses from Phoenix, Arizona Category:Disease-related deaths in California Category:Burials at Westwood Village Memorial Park Cemetery Category:20th-century American actresses
